sect1.title: SprayDelimited / SprayVariable
sect1.para:
STD.File.SprayDelimited STD.File.SprayVariable
File.SprayVariable
SprayVariable
SprayDelimited ( sourceIP , sourcepath , [ maxrecordsize ] , [ srcCSVseparator ] , [ srcCSVterminator ] , [ srcCSVquote ] , destinationgroup, destinationlogicalname , [ timeout ] , [ espserverIPport ] , [ maxConnections ] , [ allowoverwrite ] , [ replicate ] , [ compress ] , [ sourceCsvEscape ], [ failIfNoSourceFile ], [ recordStructurePresent ], [ quotedTerminator ], [ encoding ][ expireDays ])

dfuwuid := STD.File.fSprayDelimited STD.File.fSprayVariable
File.fSprayVariable
fSprayVariable
fSprayDelimited ( sourceIP , sourcepath , [ maxrecordsize ] , [ srcCSVseparator ] , [ srcCSVterminator ] , [ srcCSVquote ] , destinationgroup, destinationlogicalname , [ timeout ] , [ espserverIPport ] , [ maxConnections ] , [ allowoverwrite ] , [ replicate ] , [ compress ] , [ sourceCsvEscape ], [ failIfNoSourceFile ], [ recordStructurePresent ], [ quotedTerminator ], [ encoding ] [ expireDays ])

row.entry: A null-terminated string containing the IP address of the file.
A null-terminated string containing the path and name of the file.
Optional. An integer containing the maximum size of the records in the file. If omitted, the default is 4096.
Optional. A null-terminated string containing the CSV field separator. If omitted, the default is '\\,'
Optional. A null-terminated string containing the CSV record separator. If omitted, the default is '\\n,\\r\\n'
Optional. A null-terminated string containing the CSV quoted field delimiter. If omitted, the default is '\"'
A null-terminated string containing the name of the specific supercomputer within the target cluster.
A null-terminated string containing the logical name of the file.

Optional. An integer value indicating the timeout setting. If omitted, the default is -1. If set to zero (0), execution control returns immediately to the ECL workunit without waiting for the DFU workunit to complete.

Optional. A null-terminated string containing the protocol, IP, port, and directory, or the DNS equivalent, of the ESP server program. This is usually the same IP and port as ECL Watch, with â/FileSprayâ appended. If omitted, the default is the value in the lib_system.ws_fs_server attribute.
Optional. An integer specifying the maximum number of connections. If omitted, the default is one (1).
Optional. A boolean TRUE or FALSE flag indicating whether to allow the new file to overwrite an existing file of the same name. If omitted, the default is FALSE.
Optional. A boolean TRUE or FALSE flag indicating whether to replicate the new file. If omitted, the default is FALSE.
Optional. A boolean TRUE or FALSE flag indicating whether to compress the new file. If omitted, the default is FALSE.
Optional. A null-terminated string containing the CSV escape characters. If omitted, the default is none.
Optional. A boolean TRUE or FALSE flag indicating whether to allow the spray to fail if no source file is found. If omitted, default is FALSE.
Optional. A boolean TRUE or FALSE flag indicating whether to derive the record structure from the header of the file. If omitted, the default is FALSE.

Optional. A boolean TRUE or FALSE flag indicating whether the terminator character can be included in a quoted field. Defaults to TRUE. If FALSE, it allows quicker partitioning of the file (avoiding a complete file scan).
Optional. A integer value indicating the number of days before automatically removing the file. If omitted, the default is -1 (never expires).
A null-terminated string containing the encoding. Can be set to one of the following: ascii, utf8, utf8n, utf16, utf16le, utf16be, utf32, utf32le,utf32be. If omitted, the default is ascii.
The definition name to receive the null-terminated string containing the DFU workunit ID (DFUWUID) generated for the job.
Return:
fSprayDelimited returns a null-terminated string containing the DFU workunit ID (DFUWUID).

sect1.para: The SprayDelimited function takes a variable length file from the landing zone and distributes it across the nodes of the destination supercomputer.
The SprayVariablefunction is now called SprayDelimited and the fSprayVariablefunction is now called fSprayDelimited. The old names are still available for backward compatibility.
